scenario: American Express stock ended 2024 up 58%, outperforming the S&P 500 and ranking second in the Dow Jones Industrial Average behind Nvidia and Walmart. The company's differentiated credit card network, targeting affluent clients, generates high revenue due to annual fees and a best-in-class rewards program. Key earnings streams include fees, billed business, and net interest income, which increased 17% year over year in the third quarter to $4 billion. American Express is Warren Buffett's second-largest position, accounting for 15.3% of the Berkshire Hathaway portfolio. Moderating inflation and lower interest rates are expected to boost consumer spending and banking performance. The company's varied earnings streams, growing dividend, and global brand name make it an excellent long-term stock. American Express reports earnings on January 24, and investors may consider buying before the report to capitalize on potential post-earnings gains.
